title: [Large-Scale] Mobile Microlearning Expert Course for Designing and Improving Technical College Mathematics Curricula: Strengthening Calculation, Equation, and Statistics Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced high school mathematics foundations (calculus, linear algebra), basic curriculum design understanding, introductory statistics and probability concepts, and foundational skills in mathematical notation and graph interpretation
context.additional_context: For current practitioners, a need exists to establish a limited but efficient smartphone-based learning environment: integrating mobile-optimized formula editors, graph generation tools, statistical calculation functions, and real-time data visualization/analysis capabilities.

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to design customized math curricula for technical colleges by integrating learning design models and collective meaning-making techniques: integrating equation-graph-statistical analysis modules and applying proof techniques.

Acquire skills to develop 5-step mobile-optimized microlearning modules: applying calculation problem-solving and formula visualization techniques, and enhancing probability distribution graph generation capabilities.

Cultivate the ability to propose flexible curriculum improvements through project-based assessments: developing evaluation tools for probabilistic/statistical approaches to real engineering problems and fostering data analysis interpretation skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
